intro: Psychotria maningoryensis, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing seeds surrounded by a fleshy aril. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
